TestCase.Title: Test case TLS_B2_FR_13
TestCase.Purpose: This tests verifies that it is not possible to keep a TLS connection alive for more than the maximum allowed amount of time.
TestCase.Precondition: DUT services are online without any known disturbances.
The DUT is accepting TLS connections.

Command.Text: The tester connects to the DUT.

TestStep.Description: The TLS ClientHello offers the highest TLS version supported according to the ICS.
The TLS ClientHello offers a cipher suite that is supported according to the ICS.
In case the cipher suite is based on ECC, the TLS ClientHello offers valid elliptic curves in the appropriate extension according to the ICS.
The presence of the signature_algorithms extension depends on the used TLS version. In case it is sent, all algorithms that are supported according to the ICS are listed.
The TLS ClientHello does not contain further extensions which are not required to conduct the TLS handshake.

Command.Text: The TLS client supplies the valid certificate chain [CERT_DEFAULT_CLIENT].

ExpectedResult.Text: The TLS protocol is executed without errors and the channel is established.

Command.Text: The server tries to keep the connection running for more than the maximum allowed amount of time.

ExpectedResult.Text: The TLS connection is closed by the server.
